content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```
function extract_julia_code(md::Markdown.MD)
    # initialize an empty string to hold the extracted code
    code = ""

    # loop through each element in the Markdown document
    for elem in md.content
        # if the element is a code block, extract the code and append it to the code string
        if isa(elem, Markdown.Code)
            code *= elem.code * "\n"
        end
    end

    return code
end
```
This function takes a `Markdown.MD` object as input, which represents a parsed Markdown document. It loops through each element in the document and checks if it is a code block using the `isa` function. If it is a code block, it extracts the code and appends it to the `code` string with a newline character (`\n`). Finally, it returns the `code` string.

Note that this function assumes that the Markdown document has already been parsed into a `Markdown.MD` object using a library such as `Markdown.jl`. If the input is not a `Markdown.MD` object, you will need to parse the Markdown text first before passing it to this function.
